Interview Descriptions: They asked many questions about my approach to teaching and my experience and background. I also asked them questions which was very helpful. It was a friendly and thorough atmosphere.
Interview Questions: Asked how I would handle different student situations.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University
Interview Descriptions: The initial in-person interview went well enough; many questions centered around situational specifics (i.e. what would you do if...) scenarios. The interviewers appeared professional and business-like. Prior experience in the field may not be necessary.
Interview Questions: What have you done to prepare for this interview today?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very fast and easy if you are familiar with online teaching.  Interviewer was very easy to talk to.  I applied and received a phone call two weeks later. Within another week I was signed up to start training. After training I was assigned a course and have been teaching there for almost three years now.
Interview Questions: How do I engage with students in a inline classroom setting.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hired through temp agency. ~15 minute interview, just wanted to know more about you.Could have done over the phone, since the entire position was made up of over the phone communication. Expected more questions during the interview, but they were mass hiring (30+), so I guess they just needed bodies. once in the job, they freely fire based on skills/how easy you pick up the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an admission counselor?

title: Outcomes & Assessment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application, brief phone call to gauge interest in position, in-person interview with one manager and the director of Outcomes and Assessment. The questions were very typical of an interview--focused on group dynamics, but also ensuring that you understand the job description and asking about experience writing assessments.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where you do not agree with your manager's decision?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lightning round 10 minute interview. Did not really ask me anything related to the position or higher education. I had my work experience in higher ed on my resume and they did not even ask me anything about it. It's like they did not care. It was a very odd process.
Interview Questions: What was my customer service experience like?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH)
Interview Descriptions: Met with each member of the team before I was offered the position. Was asked more about ideas than about why I left my previous position which is great! Was told about special projects and the opportunities to advance.
Interview Questions: The most difficult questions dealt with having to continuously having to prove myself during each phase of the interviews.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Arduous, costly and demoralizing. One hurdle after another, months-long periods of waiting. Glib interviewers and opaque criteria. A smarmy place filled with anti-depressant fueled staff. In the same league as Acappella, University of Phoenix, Kaplan—don't let the quaint New England campus fool you. Nor the non-profit status. You'll end up scratching your head at the idiocy, feeling devalued and degraded. Pompous ill-written missives from  bombastic president meant to make you feel like part of something big and progressive, but the veneer quickly wears thin. Go for it if you are desperate.
Interview Questions: The usual drivel, I don't remember a single meaningful question.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University
Interview Descriptions: when applying to snhu in the advising department there are three innitial steps. A phone screening, 2nd interview in person, final interview with leadership. The 2nd interview is key, this is where they make the decision. Make sure you dress appropriately
Interview Questions: the questions are framed in a way to make you think. Do not show that they confuse you, do not show frustration.

title: Mailroom Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: the interview is very easy, jen is very nice. everyone is nice there. you can feel free to work there. its a best part time job in SNHU. if you are a student in SNHU, go apply for it
Interview Questions: how are you :D

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
1. I applied online
2. I got an email about doing a phone interview
3. Phone Interview
4. In person interview (3 person panel)
5. Final approval email with the assistant director of advising.
Interview Questions: I was asked this question twice: "What would your ideal workplace look like?" I think they're looking for what kind of culture you expect.

title: Adjunct Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They sat on my resume for something like 6 months and then did the interview. Very easy questions was seemingly hired, wasted a bunch of time on their unpaid training, filled out forms, signed off on a background check and never heard another word ever. This was a complete waste of my time.
Interview Questions: None, just say you love to help students pass their class and you will get the job but read the reviews here - you may not want the job.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: you would need to pass a 2.5 month training after getting accepted in the phone interview process and transcript evaluation. I think the interview was pretty easy, however, employee referral or some connection is kind of necessary to get the initial interview
Interview Questions: the interview was not very technical, it was mostly a series of general questions about my resume

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was very easy.  After submitting my application, I received a phone call within 2 - 3 weeks. I had a phone interview and I had to submit my teaching statement.  I found the process very easy and not intimidating.
Interview Questions: Have I had experience teaching?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview
Interview Questions: Asked about experience, classroom management style, experience with specific LMS platforms.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process began with a brief phone interview which was pretty standard and provided some insights as to what the job entailed.  Next step was an in-person interview with two advising team leads and one advising director.  In general they were very pleasant and engaging.
Interview Questions: How would I approach developing relationships with individuals only via phone and email?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online from SNHU website. Received preliminary call back a week later, then in person interview. Interview held with team of three (team lead and two others). Positive, comfortable atmosphere. Multiple interviews were being held at the same time. Very quick, easy interview, nothing out of the ordinary question wise. Was given the feeling they knew exactly the type of candidate they were looking for without much flexibility.
Interview Questions: Can you handle delivering bad news?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter does screening and briefly asks about your sales background. They want someone who doesn't fear rejection or making tons of calls
Interview Questions: Why have you chosen to do sales so many times in your life.

title: Online Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Done completely online. Never talked to a person directly. It took about 4 weeks, included written portions along the lines of teaching philosophy and how you would grade an assignment. After this was completed, they sent out separate application sheets for classes they thought you might be qualified to teach and you had to provide evidence that you could teach it (courses taken, taught, research). After there was a training session that oriented you to the job, LMS and policies.
Interview Questions: How would you grade this assignment?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was cut and dry.  They mainly talked about credentials and what courses you were interested in teaching.  They send an email prior to the interview.
Interview Questions: What classes was I interested in teaching.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to develop a course and work with an Instructional Course Developer to include all the necessary objectives of the class.  Once complete I was required to instruct the online course and to continue to develop any new material.
Interview Questions: What is my preferred teaching environment?

title: Associate Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Standard Interview. Phone screen then conference call and then full day in-person meeting on site. All the right people within senior leadership made themselves available that day. Helped my decision.
Interview Questions: Why would I want to be a part of their university?

title: COCE Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: brief and informal- they brought me into a room and asked me questions about my prior work experience and where I saw myself in the future- they were not dressed professionally but told me that It was a casual work environment
Interview Questions: why do I want to work here

title: Adjunct Faculty of Social Science Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview on how I work with students; my grading ideas and teaching philosophy.  In addition, they asked questions that focused on 'special populations' of students e.g. military and disabled and how would I handle particular situations.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my teaching experiences in the past; and provided scenarios that I had to answer based on student issues, grading, and special situations.

title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Group interview over your past experience. Nothing in details. Just going over what the company does and what they expect. Talk about your education experience. Talk about your previous work experience and hobbies and interes
Interview Questions: interview process took 1 week, 2 meetings, not very hard. talked more about position, interview process took 1 week, 2 meetings, not very hard. talked more about position, interview process took 1 week, 2 meetings, not very hard. talked more about position, interview process took 1 week, 2 meetings, not very hard. talked more about position,

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Chattanooga, TN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two phone calls that determined my skills as well as desires to teach for SNHU. They reviewed my college transcripts, and then asked questions particular to the courses they were wanting my to teach.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to teach for SNHU.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the university website. In a months time i got an email from the online campus asking me to join them for a 1:1 interview. The date and time was fixed. The interview consisted of basic questions like my prior experience, my ambition and my will to learn new things. It lasted for around an hour with a tour of the entire office included at the end. After the interview i got a call from them accepting me as their employee in a span of a week.
Interview Questions: Prior working experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Southern New Hampshire University (Manchester, NH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: the interview is not very competitive and the professors are very nice, the process it's about 1hour, two professors asked questions, one of them is the director research supervisor, the other is a high level manager, they are both very nice
Interview Questions: They asked how did I hear about this university
